item.title: Bar Plots
item.description: To begin, let’s make sure we have and bring in all the correct packages, library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) library(sqldf) library(flexdashboard) Now, what information do we want to extract for our bar plot- query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR" result<-sqldf(query) Next, in a similar process with previous plots made, let’s turn this information into an easy-to-read bar plot. Today we started to use result$name and introduced coord_flip() to ensure it did not do any additional math between our extracted data and our table

item.title: Histograms
item.description: These are the pakages we will need to make the intended histogram: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Making a histogram; First we extracted the data we wanted to appear on our graph query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) From there its similar to making a scatterplot, just approiate alterations where necessary, i.e. introduction of “bin” function ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="yellow",fill="white",bins=50)+ ggtitle("Body Weight Distribution for Baseball Players") ## Warning: Removed 854 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).
